tweet: To counter sharp power (interference, coercion and meddling) from Russia, China & others, the U.S. must continue to utilize soft power such as diplomacy, Voice of America & aid programs #BipartisanUSIP pic.twitter.com/HDsqPPrV8J
As a former U.S. Ambassador to the Holy See, I have seen the positive effects of soft power in addressing problems firsthand #BipartisanUSIP

The U.S. has used soft power successfully to achieve foreign policy goals in the past, including the defeat of Eastern European communism through programs like Radio Free Europe #BipartisanUSIP pic.twitter.com/s9rg4DfXBV

I’m joining another former ambassador, @RepDonBeyer, to discuss soft power in a sharp power world, including countering coercion and information warfare from adversaries like Russia and China. Today, the President signed an Executive Order requiring asylum seekers to process their claims at ports of entries. This is a much needed action after a decade of abuse by people trying to exploit the system that was meant to protect people with legitimate cases. (2/2)
Earlier this year I introduced the Asylum Protection Act requiring asylum seekers to declare their status when entering the United States via a port of entry. (1/2)
